parameters.name: cover
parameters.description:
Updates the card's cover
 | Option | Values | About |
 |--------|--------|-------|
 | color | `pink`, `yellow`, `lime`, `blue`, `black`, `orange`, `red`, `purple`, `sky`, `green` | Makes the cover a solid color . |
 | brightness | `dark`, `light` | Determines whether the text on the cover should be dark or light.
 | url | An unsplash URL: https://images.unsplash.com | Used if making an image the cover. Only Unsplash URLs work.
 | idAttachment | ID of an attachment on the card | Used if setting an attached image as the cover. |
 | size | `normal`, `full` | Determines whether to show the card name on the cover, or below it. |
 
 `brightness` can be sent alongside any of the other parameters, but all of the other parameters are mutually exclusive; you can not have the cover be a `color` and an `idAttachment` at the same time. 
 
 On the brightness options, setting it to light will make the text on the card cover dark:
 ![](/cloud/trello/images/rest/cards/cover-brightness-dark.png)
 
 And vice versa, setting it to dark will make the text on the card cover light: 
 ![](/cloud/trello/images/rest/cards/cover-brightness-light.png)

value.description:
An object containing information regarding the card's cover 
 `brightness` can be sent alongside any of the other parameters, but all of the other parameters are mutually exclusive; you can not have the cover be a color and an `idAttachment` at the same time.

color.description: One of: `pink, yellow, lime, blue, black, orange, red, purple, sky, green`

brightness.description: Determines whether the text on the cover should be dark or light. Setting it to `light` will make the text on the card cover dark. And vice versa, setting it to dark will make the text on the card cover light

url.description: Used if making an image the cover. Only Unsplash URLs (https://images.unsplash.com/) work.

get.description: Get an enterprise by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the enterprise to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of: `id`, `name`, `displayName`, `prefs`, `ssoActivationFailed`, `idAdmins`, `idMembers` (Note that the members array returned will be paginated if `members` is 'normal' or 'admins'. Pagination can be controlled with member_startIndex, etc, but the API response will not contain the total available result count or pagination status data. Read the SCIM documentation [here]() for more information on filtering), `idOrganizations`, `products`, `userTypes`, `idMembers`, `idOrganizations`

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: One of: `none`, `normal`, `admins`, `owners`, `all`

parameters.name: member_fields
parameters.description: One of: `avatarHash`, `fullName`, `initials`, `username`

parameters.name: member_filter
parameters.description: Pass a [SCIM-style query](/cloud/trello/scim/) to filter members. This takes precedence over the all/normal/admins value of members. If any of the member_* args are set, the member array will be paginated.

parameters.name: member_sort
parameters.description: This parameter expects a [SCIM-style](/cloud/trello/scim/) sorting value prefixed by a `-` to sort descending. If no `-` is prefixed, it will be sorted ascending. Note that the members array returned will be paginated if `members` is 'normal' or 'admins'. Pagination can be controlled with member_startIndex, etc, but the API response will not contain the total available result count or pagination status data.

parameters.name: member_sortBy
parameters.description: Deprecated: Please use member_sort. This parameter expects a [SCIM-style sorting value](/cloud/trello/scim/). Note that the members array returned will be paginated if `members` is `normal` or `admins`. Pagination can be controlled with `member_startIndex`, etc, and the API response's header will contain the total count and pagination state.

parameters.name: member_sortOrder
parameters.description: Deprecated: Please use member_sort. One of: `ascending`, `descending`, `asc`, `desc`

parameters.name: member_startIndex
parameters.description: Any integer between 0 and 100.

parameters.name: organizations
parameters.description: One of: `none`, `members`, `public`, `all`

parameters.name: organization_fields
parameters.description: Any valid value that the [nested organization field resource]() accepts.

parameters.name: organization_paid_accounts
parameters.description: Whether or not to include paid account information in the returned workspace objects

parameters.name: organization_memberships
parameters.description: Comma-seperated list of: `me`, `normal`, `admin`, `active`, `deactivated`

get.description: Find what you're looking for in Trello

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query with a length of 1 to 16384 characters

parameters.name: idBoards
parameters.description: `mine` or a comma-separated list of Board IDs

parameters.name: idOrganizations
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Organization IDs

parameters.name: idCards
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Card IDs

parameters.name: modelTypes
parameters.description: What type or types of Trello objects you want to search. all or a comma-separated list of: `actions`, `boards`, `cards`, `members`, `organizations`

parameters.name: board_fields
parameters.description: all or a comma-separated list of: `closed`, `dateLastActivity`, `dateLastView`, `desc`, `descData`, `idOrganization`, `invitations`, `invited`, `labelNames`, `memberships`, `name`, `pinned`, `powerUps`, `prefs`, `shortLink`, `shortUrl`, `starred`, `subscribed`, `url`

parameters.name: boards_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of boards returned. Maximum: 1000

parameters.name: board_organization
parameters.description: Whether to include the parent organization with board results

parameters.name: card_fields
parameters.description: all or a comma-separated list of: `badges`, `checkItemStates`, `closed`, `dateLastActivity`, `desc`, `descData`, `due`, `email`, `idAttachmentCover`, `idBoard`, `idChecklists`, `idLabels`, `idList`, `idMembers`, `idMembersVoted`, `idShort`, `labels`, `manualCoverAttachment`, `name`, `pos`, `shortLink`, `shortUrl`, `subscribed`, `url`

parameters.name: cards_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of cards to return. Maximum: 1000

parameters.name: cards_page
parameters.description: The page of results for cards. Maximum: 100

parameters.name: card_board
parameters.description: Whether to include the parent board with card results

parameters.name: card_list
parameters.description: Whether to include the parent list with card results

parameters.name: card_members
parameters.description: Whether to include member objects with card results

parameters.name: card_stickers
parameters.description: Whether to include sticker objects with card results

parameters.name: card_attachments
parameters.description: Whether to include attachment objects with card results. A boolean value (true or false) or cover for only card cover attachments.

parameters.name: organization_fields
parameters.description: all or a comma-separated list of billableMemberCount, desc, descData, displayName, idBoards, invitations, invited, logoHash, memberships, name, powerUps, prefs, premiumFeatures, products, url, website

parameters.name: organizations_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of Workspaces to return. Maximum 1000

parameters.name: member_fields
parameters.description: all or a comma-separated list of: avatarHash, bio, bioData, confirmed, fullName, idPremOrgsAdmin, initials, memberType, products, status, url, username

parameters.name: members_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of members to return. Maximum 1000

parameters.name: partial
parameters.description: By default, Trello searches for each word in your query against exactly matching words within Member content. Specifying partial to be true means that we will look for content that starts with any of the words in your query.  If you are looking for a Card titled "My Development Status Report", by default you would need to search for "Development". If you have partial enabled, you will be able to search for "dev" but not "velopment".
